title: Son's emotional plea as cancer-stricken mum is told she needs £150k after NHS treatment 'no longer available'
text:

A young boy has made an emotional video pleading for help in a bid to raise money to save his mum’s life. 
Joe Gleadell, 12, was devastated when his mum Louise, 37, was diagnosed with grade 2B cervical cancer in February last year. 
He made a video detailing her cancer journey after she was told that despite months of radiotherapy and chemotherapy, there are no more NHS treatments available. 
In a bid to help raise money for private cancer treatments, Louise’s sister Laura Gleadell, 35, set up a Just Giving, crowdfunding page and so far donations and support from social media have helped raise nearly £50,000. 
And now her eldest son, Joe, 12 has taken to YouTube to try and raise funds, reports the Loughborough Echo . Louise and her son Joe, who made a video detailing his mum's journey (Photo: Loughborough Echo) 
Louise, who also has two other boys, Mateo, 10, and baby Jude, aged one, and is partner to Matt, 40, had surgery last week and is currently in Leicester Royal Infirmary. 
The groundbreaking treatment they are trying to raise money for is called immunotherapy and has been described as the last resort for Louise. Read More "My children need a mother more than a house": Mum sells house to pay for cancer treatment abroad after being turned down by NHS 
It is designed to boost the body’s natural defences to fight the cancer. 
Her sister Laura told the Echo: “We are a close family and this has brought us even closer together - we don’t know how long Louise has left, but if we can raise enough money to be able to start these private treatments in London then there is no certainty that it will help cure the cancer, but it could give Louise longer with her three boys and that would be priceless. Louise and her youngest son Jude, who is one (Photo: Loughborough Echo) 
“We had to talk to the three boys last week and it was heart-breaking, they have known what has been going on with their mum’s treatment, but we had to tell them that there is a possibility that she could die." 
The Just Giving page currently has a goal of £50,000 but Louise’s sister Laura said that a whole course of treatment could cost £150,000. 
Louise - who also has another sister called Clare who runs Beautique, in Loughborough - has been through months of chemotherapy and radiotherapy, and cancer, which had spread to her neck but has now gone, is still in her cervix. Louise's sister Laura, left, is raising money for her treatment (Photo: Loughborough Echo) Read More Tear-jerking moment little boy celebrates end of his chemo treatments with adorable dance 
Social media users have also started drawing a symbol of a basketball with Louise’s initial on their hands and sharing it to help raise awareness of the Just Giving page. 
Louise’s father, Phil Gleadell is former assistant coach of Leicester Riders basketball team, and also works with elite basketball players from Loughborough University and Charnwood College. 
Laura said: “The support that we have received has already been incredible but we just want to try and raise as much as possible so we can do something for my sister. 
“I think it has shown how much she is really truly loved in the community, and fingers crossed we raise enough to be able to help her.” 
To donate visit their JustGiving page . Like us on Facebook
